question: What is the role of the examination committee in the state final examination?
answer: The examination committee evaluates the results of the state final examination and announces the overall result.
answer_generated: The examination committee in the state final examination is responsible for overseeing the course of the examination and the announcement of the results. They are appointed by the dean and consist of professors, docents, and other specialists approved by the faculty’s Scientific Council. The committee may also include members appointed by the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports. A report of the examination is drawn up and signed by the chair and all present members of the committee. The committee assesses several parts of the examination separately, including the presentation and defense of the thesis, examinations in specialization subjects or general topics, and possibly other parts. Multiple committees may be established for one study program, with a minimum of five members, including the chair (Document 1).
context:
Document 1: The course  of the examination  and the announcement  
of the results  of the state  final  examination  are public.  
 (2) The chair,  the vice-chair  and the members  of the examination  committee  are appointed  by the 
dean  from  among  professors,  docents  and other  specialists  approved  by the faculty’s  Scientific  
Council.   The Ministry  of Education,  Youth  and Sports  (hereinafter  as the “Ministry”)  may  appoint  
other  members  of the examination  committee  from  among  leading  experts  in the given  field.   A 
report  is drawn  of the course  of the state  final  examination,  which  is signed  by the chair  and all 
members  of the examination  committee  who  were  present  at the examination.   Multi ple 
examination  committees  may  be established  for one study  programme.   The minimum  number  of 
members,  including  the chair,  is 5.  
 (3) The state  final  examination  consists  of several  parts,  each  of which  is assessed  separately  
a) The presentation  and defence  of the bachelor  or master  thesis,  
b) Examinations  in specialization  subjects  or general  topics,  
c) Possibly  other  parts  in accordance  with  Para  5 hereof.
